meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah tried to outshout her friend to be heard.
meanings.sent2: The fans in the stadium outshouted each other to support their teams.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom playfully tried to outshout the music to tell a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outshouted all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm seemed to outshout even the loudest voices.

meanings.sent1: In the shouting contest, Mark managed to outshout everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The cheerleader's voice outshouted the rest, leading the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully tried to outshout each other in the playground.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm outshouted any doubts in the room.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice outshouted the entire audience.

meanings.definition: To speak louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, she tried to outshout her opponent to make her point.
meanings.sent2: The politician outshouted his critics during the rally.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outshouted each other to be heard by their parents.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outshouted any fears she had.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice outshouted the noise in the classroom.
